channel.title: Crystal weekly newsletter
channel.description: Weekly newsletter from the crystal linux project

item.title: Progress, Plans and Plenty of work ahead
item.description: All packages in the crystal (no longer CrystalUX!) repos will from now on be signed using PGP keys, this will require the crystal-keyring package to be installed. The Testingbranch will also return, as well as a new Developer branch, which will be even more bleeding edge and might be more broken. Ame will soon also be getting an audit for the codebase, to provide a smootjer experience. Citrine now has a final plan we will be following, it will be getting LVM on LUKS support by next week. Citrine will also be moving to a TUI interface, instead of CLI. Our getting started app "Opal" is now also in the plannings and will soon be picked up in development. Read more on the actual newsletter

item.title: Governance, AME, and Website
item.description: This project has recieved quite a bit of formalization today. Jnats has taken the role as the project lead, to resolve ties in votes among contributers or communicate with other companies/foundations. Ame (or amethyst) our in-house packaging tool, has recently been redone in rust and is now feature-complete with the python version. There will also be a meetingbetween the main members on Sunday at 1pm EST every week in our discord server. The newsletter willcome out shortly after the meeting.
